intro: Borreria finitima, commonly known as the Mexican milkweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in scrub and woodland habitats. Borreria finitima is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
